review_blob: 330ml bottle. Copper coloured IPA with an off white head which laces well. Aroma is caramel, fruit, yeast, alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, heavy bitter with the bitterness being grassy, lemon zest and pithyness. Too bitter at first, but It grew on me. This is a touch chewy on the palate, Very softly carbonated. This is really good.
500ml bottle from Aldi. Pretty average pale ale, Not a great deal to be said. Grassy hops, lagery malt. Clean but fairly insipid.

500ml bottle from Aldi. Pours a hazy amber with a decent white foamy head. Aroma is quite yeasty, fruity, sweet malt, maybe a hint of banana. Taste is pleasant, clean, lightly sweet and lightly bitter with a light peppery/grassy finish. Rather good bearing in mind the 3.8% abv. Ideal session ale.

330ml bottle. Pours golden in color with white foam which dissipates quickly. Aroma is odd - cabbage, leaves etc. Maybe even something more sinister, dare i say wet cardboard. Taste first up is bitterness but surprisingly good considering the aroma. Medium sweet, heavy bitter. Quite good considering the boiled cabbage aroma.

330ml, bottle conditioned. Pours pale good with hazy sediment particles floating around. Aroma is tropical fruit, some resin and grassyness. Touch of yeast. Taste is light/medium sweet, Medium bitter, very light sour. Very smooth on the palate. Very good.

330ml bottle. Golden color, white head, lots of lacing. Aroma is dominated by toffee, with lemon , orange and citrus pith. Taste is heavy sweet but well balanced with medium/heavy bitterness. Palate is viscous, oily, softly carbonated. Overall this is a good example of a modern strong IPA, not excessively bitter or piny.
330ml bottle. Aroma of tropical fruit. Clean lager taste, slightly fruity. Quite good.
500ml bottle. Aroma off caramel, grass and peppery hops. Light sweet , light bitter taste. A bit lacking in flavour. Not bad though.

500ml bottle. Appearance of a typical black stout, latte head, lots of lacing. Aroma is dominated by chocolate, then toast and some fruit. Smooth, full bodied, light/medium carbonation. Always been a favorite.
beer_name: Williams Brothers March of the Penguins

review_blob: 500ml bottle. Aroma is sweet caramel and fruit. Taste is light sweet and light/medium bitter with a nice dryness. Earthy , grassy, good bitter.
500ml can from Lidl. Aroma is caramel and cough syrup. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Good head, light carbonation. Surprisingly good, if a little too sweet.

500ml bottle from m&s.; Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity hops, maybe cherry amongst others. A Sherbety quality as well. Not as hoppy as i was expecting. Certainly not as bitter as i was expecting. A slight hint of cardboard. Medium sweet, lightly bitter. Refreshing.

330ml can. Pours a cloudy reddish brown with a decent head and lacing. Aroma is pithy grapefruit and herbal notes with background caramel sweetness. Taste is quite dry, particularly for a red ale. Light sweet, Medium bitter. Light and refreshing. Quite good
500ml bottle. Cloudy amber colour with a good white head. Aroma is sweet caramel and floral hops. Slight earthy quality. Ok beer, nothing special.

355ml can from M&S.; Amber colour with minimal head, which does not retain well at all. The aroma is sweet caramel and piny hops, some cookie dough. The taste is heavy sweet medium bitter. A surprising amount of sweetness based on the relatively low ABV of 4.7% and the level of hopping. Im not an expert but would suspect that sugars have been added post fermentation.
500ml can from M&S.; Aroma is mainly herbal/piny hops with background sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation, Light sweet, light bitter. Really quite enjoyable.
beer_name: Marks & Spencer Single Variety Hop Mosaic Pale Ale

review_blob: 500ml bottle from Morrisons. Aroma of caramel and tropical fruit, appearance is light amber, taste is light sweet and light bitter a little grassy. Nice soft carbonation. Overall this is pleasant but nothing special.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2016
beer_name: Heineken UK Fosters Rocks Classic Rum

review_blob: 330ml can. Aroma is very smoky, sweet caramel, chocolate and toasty malt. Appearance is almost black with a light brown head. The taste is medium sweet, light bitter and smoky. This is very viscous, velvety smooth and softly carbonated. The best smoky beer i have tried.

500ml. Full flavored blonde ale. Not really to my preference though. Sherbety lemon and maybe banana on the nose. Hoppy flavors of citrus and pine without being at all bitter. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Quite good.

500ml bottle. Reddish brown coloured porter. Off white head, small amount of lacing. Aroma is fruity malt and chocolate. Lightly bitter aftertaste but predominantly sweet in terms of taste. Quite nice but was hoping for better. Not really a porter for me.
500ml bottle. Dark reddish black colour with an off white head which dissipates quickly. Aroma of cinnamon, caramel. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. Nicely balanced spiced porter.
beer_name: Marks & Spencer Greenwich Winter Spiced Porter

review_blob: 500ml bottle from Morrisons. Golden color with a white head, some lacing. Aroma is sweet lemon with caramel, biscuit and a hint of banana. Medium sweet, light to medium bitter. Viscous in the palate with some moderate carbonation. Good.
beer_name: Shepherd Neame / Samuel Adams Blonde Ambition

review_blob: 500ml bottle. A pleasant bitter. Fairly typical but a good example of the style.
440ml can. Aroma of corn, lemon and metal. Taste is similar with light sweetness and light/medium bitterness. Reasonable body. Had worse.
500ml bottle pale, golden, clear, minimal head. Aroma is earthy, lemony. The taste is similar. Light sweet and light bitter.
500ml bottle. Pale golden colour, head dissipates quickly. Aroma is cereal, grassy. Taste is clean, lemony, light sweet and light bitter. No off notes, decent body.
750ml bottle. Dark brown ale. Aroma is pleasant, sweet and a bit doughy. The taste is not as complex as you might expect from the label deScription. Medium sweet and light bitter. A satisfying ale.
beer_name: Marks & Spencer Greenwich Ale Monnet Cognac Barrel Age

review_blob: 500ml bottle from Master of Malt. Typical hefe aroma of banana and clove with some herbal notes. The taste is medium sweet with a nice dry dunkel quality.

500ml bottle. Pours dark amber with a whitish head that dissipates fairly quickly. The aroma is sweet berries,sugary caramel and peppery. Taste is heavy sweet, medium sour, light bitter. A strong ale and quite a good one.
330ml bottle. Pours almost black with minimal head. The aroma is chocolate and hops. The taste is excellent cocoa and dark malts medium sweet and lightly bitter. A very nice porter.

500ml bottle. Golden colour with minimal head. Aroma is metallic and citrus. The taste is surprisingly good, medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Recognisably Czech in style and well above average for a supermarket lager.

440ml can from Aldi. Very pale gold in colour, the white head dissipates quickly. Aroma of cereal and lemon. Taste is clean, lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Light on flavour but not offensive in any way. Moderate carbonation.
330ml bottle. B&M; Bargains. Aroma is oak, caramel, cereal and a peppery note. The flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. Tastes quite good but not like a proper wheat beer.
beer_name: Innis & Gunn White Oak Wheat Beer

review_blob: 500ml bottle Aldi. Pours a hazy reddish gold with a reasonable white head. Aroma is caramel and fruit. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a light peppery finish. A very appealing golden ale.
440ml can Asda. Aroma is grassy, metallic and sweet. The taste is watery fairly non deScript. The only good thing I can say is that it has a low ABV of 2.8%.
330ml bottle from Asda. Golden colour, white head. The aroma is vanilla, caramel and whisky. The taste is medium sweet, lightly sour maybe a bit woody. Reasonably good.
beer_name: Belhaven Speyside Oak Aged Blonde Ale

review_blob: 500ml bottle from Asda. Dark reddish brown with an off white head. Aroma is fruity and vinous with a little dark chocolate. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. A good example of 80/- recognisable as a Broughton beer. Good stuff.
500ml bottle from Asda. Pours golden with a white head. The aroma is sweet caramel with a hint of citrus lime. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. A good quality and refreshing bitter
500ml bottle Aldi. Pours a hazy gold with a white head which dissipates quickly. A reasonably good Weissbier. Aroma of banana and sugar. Taste is medium sweet and light sour.

500ml bottle Aldi. Pours a reddish brown with an off white head. The aroma is sweet caramel and cough sweets. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a little herbiness. A nice red ale, not too sweet.

500ml bottle from Aldi. Pours golden in colour with a white head which dissipates fairly quickly. The aroma is of caramel, sweet cookie dough and citrus fruit. The taste is medium to heavy sweet with medium bitterness from the hops. The bitterness is slightly pithy but pleasantly so. A good depth to this beer. As good an IPA I have had at this low ABV of 4.5%.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016
On tap, pint, Bavarian Brauhaus, Bothwell Street, Glasgow. Decent lager but a little light on flavour.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016
Cask at the Pot Still, Hope Street, Glasgow. Red in colour with absolutely no head and no fizz. Hard to judge this caramel aroma and medium sweet flavour. Did not finish.
Cask at the Pot Still, Hope Street, Glasgow. Amber with a decent white head. Pretty average really. Not much aroma to speak of, the taste is more Golden Ale than IPA.

750ml bottle. Dark (reddish) brown ale with a buff head. Aroma is sweet caramel and banana. Taste encompasses the same but also a light clove spice and doughy sweetness. Not an off note in sight. A lovely ale, a bit light in aroma terms but not on the palate.

330ml bottle from Sainsburys. A nice dark ale with noticeable bourbon tones. Sweet fruity aromas and sweet bourbon notes on the palate. Minimal carbonation on this bottle, could really have done with more.
beer_name: Innis & Gunn Bourbon Cask Dark Ale

review_blob: 355ml bottle poured into a tulip glass. Appearance is nearly black with a brown head which dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, some fruit (maybe dates), some alcohol. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a dry nutty finish. On the palate this beer really shines with a velvety smooth texture that is lightly carbonated and not sticky. Overall this is a very rich and full flavoured stout. Excellent.
